data.title: Snippet list does not render correctly
data.body:
#3159

When looking through the snippet list I get some strange rendering.  

There are definitely 5 snippets in the list but only 4 show up until I arrow through the complete set of 5.  Once I did that the list rendered correctly.  I would not have known there were 5 items if the sample screenshot did not show 5 (vs the 4 I could see).

I also saw some other partial rendering issues such as the double up in the image below.

![screen shot 2016-02-23 at 8 33 12 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1051190/13258726/31611f42-da09-11e5-8eef-aa890f663929.png)

data.title: [folding] Add code folding for markdown based on heading level

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
``` markdown
# Some heading

Collapsing `#` should collapse all lower level headings; `##`, `###`, etc.

## Another heading

Collapsing `##` should collapse all lower level headings; `###`, `####`, etc.

### Another heading

And so on...
```

data.title: [debug] can not stop on 'parseInt'
data.body:
When testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/2832 I tried to set a function breakpoint on 'parseInt', but that doesn't seem to be supported.
It worked for setTimeout and for my own global functions

data.title: No timeout error when timing out due to restart: true
data.body:
Testing #3238

While successfully debugging using `restart: true` and nodemon, I created a syntax error and waited. The debugger eventually stopped attempting to connect after 10 seconds. There was no UI error indicating what happened. The console did have errors though.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13257530/79e4a090-da4f-11e5-8bcf-d1b333fffcc6.png)

Note that the error does appear on an initial failed attach attempt:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13257583/c440f184-da4f-11e5-8b5e-d4cc4ee997bd.png)

data.title: Debug console always comes up when attaching to target
data.body:
Testing #3238

When attaching to a process, we surely get no debug output at all from it. Yet, the debug console still always pops up. It's very distracting.

Especially when using the `restart: true` option:

![bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13257368/c4ba3356-da4e-11e5-81a1-4f982e65ec48.gif)

ping @weinand

data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13257016/5f01baa8-da4d-11e5-8145-76796fbad7be.png)

I'm missing the `type`.

data.title: [powershell] `configuration` and `node` keywords aren't highlighted

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: On Mac OS X, the `configuration` keyword isn't being syntax highlighted for the PowerShell language. Is this an easy fix? Same goes for `node` keyword. Cheers, Trevor Sullivan Microsoft MVP: PowerShell

data.title: Inform the user that the extension is being installed
data.body:
Testing #2831

Since we don't have progress of extension installation just show an Info message with the fact that the extension is being installed once you start installing the mono-debug extension.

data.title: mono-debug extension should not be offered for installation on Windows
data.body:
#2831

Just check whether we do.

data.title: VS Code debugger doesn't exit after program run
data.body:
When debugging the following simple project (only a `gulpfile.js`), the debugger doesn't exit after the last line of code has been executed:

[Gulp4ParallelTest.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/142778/Gulp4ParallelTest.zip)

---

``` json
{   "version": "0.2.0"
,   "configurations":
    [   {   "name": "Gulp"
        ,   "type": "node"
        ,   "request": "launch"
        ,   "program": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/gulp/bin/gulp.js"
        ,   "stopOnEntry": false
        ,   "args": []
        ,   "cwd": "${workspaceRoot}"
        ,   "runtimeExecutable": null
        ,   "runtimeArgs":
            [   "--nolazy"
            ]
        ,   "env":
            {   "NODE_ENV": "development"
            }
        ,   "externalConsole": false
        ,   "sourceMaps": false
        ,   "outDir": null
        }
    ]
}
```

data.title: Improve relative paths in launch.json migration
data.body:
I've hit this while testing #2940:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13255006/4bd56ec4-da44-11e5-8ecf-410858ea17af.png)

I didn't know how to fix, since the file exists in the repository. After a while I opened `launch.json` and found the warning:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13254991/396743b6-da44-11e5-9e20-4bafda1f0a69.png)
- This should be a red error, not a green warning, since debug won't work.
- The original error should have informed me about the possible problem, since I wasn't aware of the change of `${workspaceRoot}`

data.title: Allow a config option to change default line sequence (CRLF and LF)
data.body:
Unless I am missing an existing configuration option (searched through the default settings, nothing jumped out at me), VS Code will always default to CRLF (at least on Windows).

For developers targeting cross platform (particularly with publishing packages to npm, for example) it would be nice to be able to set a user setting to default to LF instead of CRLF (or vice versa for other scenarios).

data.title: Proposal: Have Chalk and other modules output to debug console
data.body:
Debugging using colored output doesn't seem possible in VS code:

![vs code color](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9283914/13254941/ef825614-da43-11e5-96f1-07f215c6255a.png)

Can we have the standard output of the debugger redirected to the Debug Console window so colored debugging output becomes possible?

data.title: Default value of preLaunchTask should be null and not an empty string
Suggest to rename "Shell Command" to "Code Shell Command"
data.body:
On testing #3241:

In the Command Palette "Shell Command" sounds very generic and it might be not clear what's behind this. I suggest to change it to "Code Shell Command" or "Code Command Line Tool" (which would even work on Windows).

![2016-02-23 15-22-50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1898161/13254480/bb1cca3c-da41-11e5-9505-6cfda792852f.png)

data.title: Bad phrasing in debug pre launch task
data.body:
Testing #2940
## 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13254679/a8d48d0a-da42-11e5-873d-ab61b5ad1903.png)

Maybe something more like:

```
Errors detected while running task 'compile'.
```
## 

Also:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13254868/abfc8982-da43-11e5-966e-1abe1eb8ade1.png)

What's up with the _unique_?

```
Could not find the task 'dsa'. Make sure the task exists and it has a unique name.
```

And this should not be a warning, but an error, since debugging could not go on.

data.title: Duplicate definition warnings upon opening markdown file
data.body:
1. Open a markdown file
2. Notice duplicate definition warnings

Joh must have introduced this with the markdown preview, giving to Alex so he is aware and we can forward to Joh if this is not for endgame week.

data.title: Wording of telemetry options
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/13254143/4af406a4-da40-11e5-86bc-5b3cfb0686de.png)
- VSCode should be 'VS Code' or 'Visual Studio Code'
- Should we also advice that extension should follow this setting? In that case we could name it 'Allow usage data and errors to be collected by Microsoft or by extension authors'

I know that we can't enforce that, but good behaving extensions should follow it.

data.title: Working files list does not re-order if file is reopened
data.body:
Related to #2791 
- Open 10 files so the working files list is full
- Open the first file again, notice that it is not sorted to the top of the working files list
- This produces inconsistencies between quick open (showing working files) and working files list

![screen shot 2016-02-23 at 15 13 39](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13254183/902b808a-da40-11e5-9b1c-978a9f7dc42a.png)

data.title: Duplicated 'Telemetry configuration' section
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6461412/13253842/82ed2eac-da3e-11e5-8082-0f3d9003781e.png)

Should the sections have different titles, or would you prefer that they are merged? If you can't define them at a single place we can also add code that does the merging. (assign to me then)

data.title: Support a localized version of the Readme.md

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
see also #3289.

To complete a multi-language experience for extensions, there should also be support for a locale specific version of the README.md.

data.title: [folding] Stepping through 'Find' results does not expand their occurrences
data.body:
On testing #2994:
- 'Fold All' a file that has indented structure
- do a 'Find' with some text that occurs in the folded region
- step through the find results
  Observe: the collapsed occurrences are not expanded

data.title: [folding] Double clicking a 'Find All References' does not expand a folded occurrence
data.body:
On testing #2994:
- prepare a file where an object 'needle' is inside a structure that can be folded
- 'Fold All' the structure
- add 'needle' to the unfolded part of the file
- do a 'File All References'
- in the result double click on the occurrence from the collapsed region
  Observe: the occurrence is not revealed, that is the collapsed region is not expanded

data.title: None of the task snippets resolve to a working tasks.json setup
data.body:
Related to #3159

If you run `Configure Task Runner` on a brand new workspace, select `tsc` and run the `Run Task` action in the command palette, you get informed that there are no tasks found:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22350/13253611/23823170-da3d-11e5-8ebd-ec5ce554464e.png)

This is true for all snippets.

data.title: deb.package shows License: Unknown, updates: Unknown
data.body:
